refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A gtk.IconSource contains a gtk.gdk.Pixbuf (or an image filename) that serves as the base image for one or more of the icons in a gtk.IconSet, along with a specification for which icons in the icon set will be based on that pixbuf or image file. By default, the icon source has all parameters wildcarded. That is, the icon source can be used as the base icon for any desired text direction, widget state, or icon size.

refsect1.title: Constructor

listitem.simpara: a new gtk.IconSource

refsect1.para: Creates a new gtk.IconSource. A gtk.IconSource contains a gtk.gdk.Pixbuf (or image filename) that serves as the base image for one or more of the icons in a gtk.IconSet, along with a specification for which icons in the icon set will be based on that pixbuf or image file. By default, the icon source has all parameters wildcarded. That is, the icon source will be used as the base icon for any desired text direction, widget state, or icon size.

refsect2.title: gtk.IconSource.copy

listitem.simpara: a new gtk.IconSource

refsect2.para: The copy() method creates a copy of the icon source.

refsect2.title: gtk.IconSource.free

warning.para: This method is deprecated and should not be used. Use of this method may cause your application to crash.

refsect2.para: The free() method frees a dynamically-allocated icon source, along with its filename, size, and pixbuf fields if those are not None.

refsect2.title: gtk.IconSource.set_filename

listitem.simpara: the image file to use

refsect2.para: The set_filename() method sets the name of the image file (specified by filename) to use as the base image when creating icon variants for a gtk.IconSet. The filename must be absolute.

refsect2.title: gtk.IconSource.set_pixbuf

listitem.simpara: the pixbuf to use as a source

refsect2.para: The set_pixbuf() method sets a pixbuf (specified by pixbuf) to use as a base image when creating icon variants for a gtk.IconSet. If an icon source has both a filename and a pixbuf set, the pixbuf will take priority.

refsect2.title: gtk.IconSource.get_filename

listitem.simpara: the image filename

refsect2.para: The get_filename() method retrieves the source filename, or None if none is set.

refsect2.title: gtk.IconSource.get_pixbuf

listitem.simpara: the source pixbuf

refsect2.para: The get_pixbuf() method retrieves the source pixbuf, or None if none is set.

refsect2.title: gtk.IconSource.set_direction_wildcarded

listitem.simpara: if True wildcard the text direction

refsect2.para: The set_direction_wildcarded() method determines whether the icon source direction is wildcarded according to the value specified by setting. If setting is True the text direction is wildcarded and the icon source can be used as the base image for an icon in any text direction (gtk.TEXT_DIR_NONE, gtk.TEXT_DIR_LTR or gtk.TEXT_DIR_RTL). If the text direction is not wildcarded, then the text direction the icon source applies to should be set with the set_direction() method and the icon source will only be used with that text direction. Non-wildcarded icon sources (exact matches) are preferred over wildcarded icon sources. An exact match will be used when possible.

refsect2.title: gtk.IconSource.set_state_wildcarded

listitem.simpara: if True wildcard the widget state

refsect2.para: The set_state_wildcarded() method determines whether the icon source state is wildcarded according to the value of setting. If setting is True the widget state is wildcarded and the icon source can be used as the base image for an icon in any widget state (gtk.STATE_NORMAL, gtk.STATE_ACTIVE, gtk.STATE_PRELIGHT, gtk.STATE_SELECTED or gtk.STATE_INSENSITIVE). If the widget state is not wildcarded, then the widget state the icon source applies to should be set with the set_state() method and the icon source will only be used with that specific state. Non-wildcarded icon sources (exact matches) are preferred over wildcarded icon sources. An exact match will be used when possible.

A gtk.IconSet will normally transform wildcarded icon source images to produce an appropriate icon for a given state, for example lightening an image on prelight, but will not modify source images that match exactly.

refsect2.title: gtk.IconSource.set_size_wildcarded

listitem.simpara: if True wildcard the widget state

refsect2.para: The set_size_wildcarded() determines whether the icon source can be used as the basis for an icon of any size according to the value of setting. If setting is True the icon size is wildcarded and the icon source can be used as the base image for an icon of any size. If the size is not wildcarded, then the size the icon source applies to should be set with gtk.IconSource.set_size() and the icon source will only be used with that specific size. Non-wildcarded icon sources (exact matches) are preferred over wildcarded icon sources. An exact match will be used when possible.
gtk.IconSet will normally scale wildcarded source images to produce an appropriate icon at a given size, but will not change the size of source images that match exactly.

refsect2.title: gtk.IconSource.get_size_wildcarded

listitem.simpara: True if this icon source is a base for any icon size variant

refsect2.para: The get_size_wildcarded() method gets the value set by the set_size_wildcarded() method.

refsect2.title: gtk.IconSource.get_state_wildcarded

listitem.simpara: True if this icon source is a base for any widget state variant

refsect2.para: The get_state_wildcarded() method gets the value set by the set_state_wildcarded() method.

refsect2.title: gtk.IconSource.get_direction_wildcarded

listitem.simpara: True if this icon source is a base for any text direction variant

refsect2.para: The get_direction_wildcarded() method gets the value set by the set_direction_wildcarded() method.

refsect2.title: gtk.IconSource.set_direction

listitem.simpara: the text direction this icon source applies to

refsect2.para: The set_direction() method sets the text direction according to the value of direction that the icon source is intended to be used with. The value of direction must be one of: gtk.TEXT_DIR_NONE, gtk.TEXT_DIR_LTR or gtk.TEXT_DIR_RTL.

Setting the text direction on an icon source makes no difference if the text direction is wildcarded. Therefore, you should usually call the set_direction_wildcarded() method with a setting of False to un-wildcard it in addition to calling this function.

refsect2.title: gtk.IconSource.set_state

listitem.simpara: the widget state this source applies to

refsect2.para: The set_state() method sets the widget state specified by state that the icon source is intended to be used with. The value of state must be one of: gtk.STATE_NORMAL, gtk.STATE_ACTIVE, gtk.STATE_PRELIGHT, gtk.STATE_SELECTED or gtk.STATE_INSENSITIVE. Setting the widget state on an icon source makes no difference if the state is wildcarded. Therefore, you should usually call the set_state_wildcarded() method with a setting of False to un-wildcard it in addition to calling this function.

refsect2.title: gtk.IconSource.set_size

listitem.simpara: the icon size this source applies to

refsect2.para: The set_size() method sets the icon size specified by size that the icon source is intended to be used with. Setting the icon size for an icon source makes no difference if the size is wildcarded. Therefore, you should usually call the gtk.IconSource.set_size_wildcarded() method with a setting of False to un-wildcard it in addition to calling this function.

refsect2.title: gtk.IconSource.get_direction

listitem.simpara: the text direction the icon source matches

refsect2.para: The get_direction() method obtains the text direction this icon source applies to. The return value is only useful and meaningful if the text direction is not wildcarded.

refsect2.title: gtk.IconSource.get_state

listitem.simpara: the widget state the icon source matches

refsect2.para: The get_state() method obtains the widget state this icon source applies to. The return value is only useful and meaningful if the widget state is not wildcarded.

refsect2.title: gtk.IconSource.get_size

listitem.simpara: the icon size this source matches.

refsect2.para: The get_size() method obtains the icon size this source applies to. The return value is only useful and meaningful if the icon size is not wildcarded.

refsect2.title: gtk.IconSource.set_icon_name

listitem.simpara: an icon name to

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.4 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_icon_name() method uses the name specified by icon_name to look up an icon in the current icon theme to use as a base image when creating icon variants for gtk.IconSet.
In PyGTK 2.10 and above, icon_name may be None to unset the icon name.

refsect2.title: gtk.IconSource.get_icon_name

listitem.simpara: the icon name or None if no name is set.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.4 and above.

refsect2.para: The get_icon() method returns the source icon name, or None if no name is set.

refsect2.title: gtk.icon_size_lookup

listitem.simpara: an icon size
a 2-tuple containing the width and height of the specified icon_size

refsect2.title: gtk.icon_size_lookup_for_settings

listitem.simpara: a gtk.Settings object used to determine which user preferences to use.
an icon size
a 2-tuple containing the width and height of the specified icon_size or None if icon_size was invalid.

note.para: This function is available in PyGTK 2.4 and above.

refsect2.para: The gtk.icon_size_lookup_for_settings() function returns a 2-tuple containing the width and height of the icon size specified by icon_size of None if icon_size was not valid. The value of icon_size must be one of:
or an integer value returned from the gtk.icon_size_register() function.

refsect2.title: gtk.icon_size_register

listitem.simpara: the name of the icon size
the width of the icon size
the height of the icon size
an integer representing the icon size

refsect2.para: The gtk.icon_size_register() function registers a new icon size for the specified width and height with the specified name and returns the integer used to represent the icon size.

refsect2.title: gtk.icon_size_register_alias

listitem.simpara: an alias for target
an integer representing an existing icon size

refsect2.para: The gtk.icon_size_register_alias() function registers the specified alias as another name for the icon size specified by target.

refsect2.title: gtk.icon_size_from_name

listitem.simpara: a name of an existing icon size
the icon size associated with name

refsect2.para: The gtk.icon_size_from_name() function returns the integer representing the icon size associated with the specified name.

refsect2.title: gtk.icon_size_get_name

listitem.simpara: an integer representing an existing icon size
the name associated with the icon size represented by size

refsect2.para: The gtk.icon_size_get_name() function returns the name of the icon size represented by size.
